text.headline: King Collins Design
text.text:
Red Feather Golf and Social Club is a private golf club in Lubbock, Texas and was designed by Rob King and Tad Collins. Rob and Tad have been leaders in new ideas design variety over the past few years with the Sweetens Cove and Landmand. The course opened in the second half of 2023. The property covers 135 acres of land featuring 18 holes of championship golf with 7000+ yards from the back tees.

Owner Brad Ralston invested in sustainable measures for water collection in the 6 acre lake onsite. Additional wells off-site are available as well.

Fairways are Innovation Zoysia grass. Innovation Zoysia was developed at Texas A&M. Greens were seeded in T-1 Bentgrass.

Garrett Holt, Director of Agronomy is the grow-in superintendent and will stay on as the club's permanent course manager overseeing the grounds.

Lubbock's turfgrass growing conditions are a semi-arid climate with a hot and dry summer vs. generally a mild winter. Average temperature in Lubbock ranges from 34°F in January vs. 93°F in July. Red Feather should average about 18 inches of rainfall per season, mostly during spring and summer.
